metadata.title: CVE-2020-10735 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible
metadata.description: A flaw was found in python. In algorithms with quadratic time complexityusing non-binary bases, when using int("text"), a system could take 50ms toparse an int string with 100,000 digits and 5s for 1,000,000 digits (float,decimal, int.from_bytes(), and int() for binary bases 2, 4, 8, 16, and 32are not affected). The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'change too intrusive').
python3.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'change too intrusive').
python3.9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'change too intrusive').
